intro: Bartlingia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile bartlingia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of streams, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Bartlingia sessilis is often found in swampy areas and is an important component of wetland ecosystems.
